intro: Plantago argyrea, commonly known as silver plantain, is a flowering plant native to temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere. It is a perennial herb that typically grows to a height of 10–30 centimeters, featuring a basal rosette of silver-gray, hairy leaves. The plant produces small, inconspicuous greenish-white flowers arranged in a spike-like inflorescence. Its leaves are often used in traditional medicine for their soothing properties. Botanically, it belongs to the Plantaginaceae family and is characterized by its mucilaginous secretions.
